plugin.name: JFlex Maven Plugin
plugin.description: This is a Maven 3 plugin to generate Lexer code in Java from a Lexer specification, using JFlex.

mojo.description: Generates lexical scanners from one or more JFlex grammar files.

parameter.name: backup
parameter.description: A flag whether to enable the generation of a backup copy if the generated source file already exists.

parameter.name: dot
parameter.description: Whether to produce graphviz .dot files for the generated automata. This feature is EXPERIMENTAL.

parameter.name: dump
parameter.description: Whether to dump full debug information.

parameter.name: encodingName
parameter.description: The name of the character encoding for reading lexer specifications. Uses JVM default encoding if unset.

parameter.name: generationMethod
parameter.description: The generation method to use for the scanner. The only valid value is pack.

parameter.name: legacyDot
parameter.description: If true, the dot (.) metachar matches [^\n] instead of [^\n\r\u000B\u000C\u0085\u2028\u2029].

parameter.name: lexDefinitions
parameter.description: List of grammar definitions to run the JFlex parser generator on. Each path may either specify a single grammar file or a directory. Directories will be recursively scanned for files with one of the following extensions: '.jflex', '.flex', '.jlex' or '.lex'. By default, all files in src/main/jflex will be processed.

parameter.name: minimize
parameter.description: A flag whether to perform the DFA minimization step during scanner generation.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Name of the directory into which JFlex should generate the parser.

parameter.name: staleMillis
parameter.description: The granularity in milliseconds of the last modification date for testing whether a source needs regeneration.

parameter.name: unusedWarning
parameter.description: Whether a warning will be logged when there are unused macros.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Whether source code generation should be verbose.
